name: 'King of the Hill' - 'Square Peg' Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: At the beginning of this episode it is noted that Hank Hill has a back problem.  Hank has a back brace that he is supposed to wear, but he doesn't like it.  What does he derisively call the thing?
questions.explanation:
Girdle.

	Peggy has purchased a weightlifting belt for Hank, but Hank has difficulty wearing it.  Poor Hank suffers so much that Peggy has to massage him and apply Icy-Hot.  When Bobby comes in and sees Hank with his shirt off, Hank becomes alarmed and says, 'Peggy, not in front of the B-O-Y!'

questions.text: Bobby enters the room with his parents and presents them with a permission slip.  The permission slip is for a sexual education class.  Which of these is the first thing done to the permission slip?
questions.correct: It is torn up by Hank
options: Peggy signs it, but Hank refuses
Peggy and Hank both sign it
questions.explanation:
It is torn up by Hank.

	Eventually, Peggy and Hank decide that they will teach Bobby about sex themselves.  However, when neither can muster the guts to do it, they run to the garbage can and reassemble the permission slip so they can sign it.

questions.text: It is in this episode that we first hear about Peggy's 'Substitute Teacher of the Year' award.  In which year did she win this award?
questions.explanation:
1996.

	This is one of Peggy Hill's major points of pride, and she mentions it often throughout the run of the series.  Hank uses the fact that Peggy is an 'expert' substitute teacher as a way of cajoling her to go in and talk to Bobby about sex.

questions.text: After some discussion, it is decided that Hank will go into Bobby's room and describe the birds and bees to Bobby.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Hank uses the excuse that his back is 'out' and flatters Peggy with her 'Substitute Teacher of the Year' award.  Peggy is stuck with the task of teaching Bobby about the facts of life.  This leads to one of the classic lines from the show. Peggy enters Bobby's room and asks, 'Bobby, what do you know about sexual relations?'  Bobby responds, 'I don't know.  Nothing much.  I'm a little worried about being a slut.'  Classic!

questions.text: Outside talking with the boys, Hank reveals the method that his father used to teach him about sex.  It involved the observation of which type of animal?
questions.explanation:
Cows.

	Apparently, Hank Hill learned about sex by observing 'love' between a bull and a cow.  The young Hank cried during the spectacle.  Hank later attempts to use the same method in teaching Bobby by taking him to the local dairy farm.  Hank is so horrified by what he sees there that he and Peggy decide to reassemble and sign the permission slip.

questions.text: In 'Square Peg' we learn that Luanne is currently receiving an education at what type of vocational school?
questions.explanation:
Beauty school.

	Luanne claims that her beauty school homework is 'hard'.  Luanne is studying from a book entitled 'Advanced Hairstyling Theory'.

questions.text: In one hilarious scene, Bobby and Joseph Gribble are playing with action figures from the television show 'Friends'.  Bobby asks Joseph which character he wants to play with.  Joseph asks, 'Can I shoot him full of BBs?'  After Bobby nods in agreement, which character does Joseph take?
questions.explanation:
Ross.

	Apparently, Joseph is not a big fan of David Schwimmer, who plays Ross on the show 'Friends'.  This scene makes one wonder what Mike Judge thinks about the show 'Friends'!

questions.text: Which individual makes a threatening phone call to both the school and to Peggy after Peggy is chosen to replace the sexual education teacher?
questions.explanation:
Dale.

	Dale, or 'some right wing nut' as Peggy suggests', makes a phone call to the school threatening the life of the sex ed teacher.  After she promptly quits and Peggy takes over, Dale makes several threatening phone calls to the Hill residence.  Naturally, these phone calls are simply too comical to sound truly threatening.

questions.text: We learn the name of Bobby's middle school during this episode.  After which Texas notable is Bobby's school named?
questions.explanation:
Tom Landry.

	Tom Landry, former coach of the Dallas Cowboys, has had his name immortalized by Bobby's Arlen, Texas middle school.  Tom Landry also happens to be one of Hank Hill's heroes.

questions.text: When Peggy Hill finally begins the sexual education class, she asks for the children's permission slips.  All of them have had permission to learn about sex from the class except Bobby.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Actually, Bobby is the only student who remains in the class at the end.  All of the other students have not been given permission to learn sex ed.  This may be Mike Judge's statement that sex ed should best be left to parents.
